author: _shemnon
content: We are serving the configurations, not the fork name. The way to sus out what fork can also be done via eth_call for the most part and other calls to probe the locations.

author: _shemnon
content: The format is <what is being configured> = <the configuration>.  For precompiles since we start from 0 and increment one-by-one what we are configuring is if the next precompile set is activated.  For system contracts we are configuring where certain contracts are.  There was a proposal to make it address->name, but for system contracts that had bad usability because we then had to search for system contract names.  I'm open to flipping it for precompiles to be name->address, but when I made that offer in the PR proposing the change it was passed over and the current format is used.
